summary: An Ordinance authorizing and directing the Mayor and City Comptroller of the City of Seattle to issue and deliver to the State of Washington negotiable bonds of the City of Seattle in the sum of six hundred thousand dollars, ($600,000.) with interest at the rate of three and three-quarters (3 3/4) per cent. Per annum, payable semi-annually, from the date of the issue of such bonds; which bonds were authorized to be issued by the special election held in the City of Seattle on the six day of March, 1906, pursuant to Ordinance No. 13242.
